{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3146753,"name":"Travis","username":"TravisThomp","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-16T16:31:17.569Z","cooked":"

Hello,

I’ve been trying to install robotpy[ctre] on my raspberry pi to get access to the talon srx library in python. During my pip install I keep getting stuck when building wheels for robotpy-wpimath
“Building wheel for robotpy-wpimath (pyproject.toml): started”.

My os is 64 bit.

My pip version is 23.0
My python version is 3.9.2
My install command is “pip install -U robotpy[ctre] --verbose”

Please let me know if anyone knows how I could fix this install?

image1472×429 21.8 KB

How long did you wait? I’d expect building wpimath on a raspberry pi to take hours or days.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-16T17:22:49.473Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":1,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":54.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427049,"topic_slug":"problem-installing-robotpy-ctre-on-raspberry-pi-os-lite","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57338,"username":"TravisThomp","name":"Travis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/8c91f0/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/problem-installing-robotpy-ctre-on-raspberry-pi-os-lite/427049/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3146812,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-16T17:43:52.486Z","cooked":"

We distribute prebuilt wheels for aarch64 for all wpilib components, so you can use those via:

pip install --find-links=https://tortall.net/~robotpy/wheels/2023/raspbian/ robotpy

This is mentioned briefly at RobotPy Components — RobotPy 2023 documentation

However, CTRE does not distribute binaries for Raspberry Pi (or if they do, we don’t build wheels that include them), so installation of robotpy-ctre on a Pi is not possible at this time. If you read the CTRE vendor json, it doesn’t mention anything other than x86, macOS, or Windows.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-02-16T17:46:15.230Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":45,"readers_count":44,"score":19.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427049,"topic_slug":"problem-installing-robotpy-ctre-on-raspberry-pi-os-lite","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://robotpy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/install/components.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"RobotPy Components — RobotPy 2023 documentation","clicks":14},{"url":"https://maven.ctr-electronics.com/release/com/ctre/phoenix/Phoenix5-frc2023-latest.json","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/problem-installing-robotpy-ctre-on-raspberry-pi-os-lite/427049/3","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3146840,"name":"Jacob Caporuscio","username":"Jacob_C","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-16T18:11:12.557Z","cooked":"

As a heads up we do distribute binaries for Arm32 and 64 platforms (using ‘arm32’ and ‘arm64’ as classifiers, respectively) that will work with raspberry pi. They’re not included in the vendordep since that’s not a normal use we’ve encountered for wpilib projects (I think WPILib on pi is sim-only because there would need to be a separate HAL?).

Also note that our non-FRC language support is currently C++ only (which I think is fine for RobotPy since iirc that’s what gets wrapped for the libraries) and does require a SocketCAN device for CAN communication.

Currently the way to get arm32 and arm64 bins of Phoenix is to clone the Phoenix Linux SocketCAN example from our repo that contains the binaries directly, though we have a preliminary version of apt package support that will likely be completed and documented after the end of the season.

@virtuald If building robotpy ctre wheels for raspberry pi is something you’re interested in let me know and we can figure out the easiest path for you to include the binaries.

We used to have ARM builds but they got removed when we last auto-generating our manifest from the vendor JSON. If you have suggestions for we can include your ARM SocketCAN libraries without a large maintenance burden on our end I’m all ears.

piwheels used to build and host raspberry pi builds of robotpy that would automatically be picked up with pip. But those have been failing post 2021 so tortall install is now required.
